title: 114_hr2952
content: The Act titled "Improving Employment Outcomes of TANF Recipients Act" aims to enhance the economic mobility of TANF recipients. Section 403(a)(4) of the Social Security Act is amended to improve economic mobility of TANF recipients by measuring state performance through collecting and reporting necessary information for indicators. The indicators for a fiscal year include the employment percentage, calculated based on the number of families receiving assistance under State programs funded with qualified State expenditures. The retention percentage for the fiscal year is calculated by dividing the number of families with an adult in unsubsidized employment after exiting the program by the number of families who received assistance in the exit quarter. The retention percentage is calculated by dividing the number of families exiting the State program who have an adult in unsubsidized employment in the 4th quarter after exit by the total number of families receiving assistance in the exit quarter. The advancement measure for the fiscal year is the median earnings of adults receiving assistance under the State program funded with qualified State expenditures. The State must agree with the Secretary on performance levels for indicators in fiscal years 2019 and 2020 for individuals exiting the program and entering unsubsidized employment. The State and the Secretary must establish performance levels for indicators, comparing them with other States and adjusting them using an objective statistical model. The State and the Secretary must establish performance levels for indicators, comparing them with other States and adjusting them using an objective statistical model, including differences in economic conditions such as unemployment rates and job losses or gains in specific industries. Upon entry into the program, participant characteristics such as prior work history, educational or occupational skills attainment, and other factors affecting employment and earnings are assessed. The State must agree with the Secretary on performance levels for indicators before fiscal year 2021 to promote continuous improvement in performance. Revisions may be made based on economic factors. The Secretary will revise performance levels based on economic conditions and participant characteristics using an objective statistical model. The Secretary will develop a model for reporting state performance outcomes under the program funded by the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act. The Secretary will develop a model for reporting state performance outcomes under the program funded by the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act, including details on the number of individuals who exited the program and their reasons for doing so. The Secretary will develop a model for reporting state performance outcomes under the program funded by the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act, including details on the number of individuals who exited the program, the length of time they received assistance, their educational level, earnings in the preceding 4 quarters, and performance levels achieved. Reports will be made available electronically to the public annually. The Secretary will develop regulations in consultation with the Secretary of Labor to measure State performance on indicators for reports submitted annually under the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act. The amendments made by this Act will be effective on October 1, 2016, with the title changed to focus on increasing employment, job retention, and earnings of former TANF recipients.
